alert.note: Alert for Eastern Teton; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:38PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Teton County through 730 PM MDT... At 637 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking several thunderstorm across Teton County, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail are possible with any of the thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Choteau, Dutton, Power, Collins and Farmington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 305 and 319. Highway 287 between mile markers 49 and 64. Highway 89 between mile markers 26 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for north central Montana.
